The unsafe zone also includes areas where tissue planes are less distinct and where inadvertent injury to vital structures could occur.

The boundary between safe and unsafe regions is marked by a transition from clearer, fatty tissue to more complex, vascular-appearing structures. The surgical instrument visible in the image is appropriately positioned near the safe zone, demonstrating proper technique in approaching the dissection. The unsafe region requires careful identification of structures before any dissection can proceed to avoid potential complications.

The image shows active dissection in progress, highlighting the importance of maintaining awareness of these anatomical zones to ensure safe surgical progression. The clear distinction between the fatty anterior tissue and the more complex deeper structures helps guide appropriate dissection planes.
